question:
Your friend has been offered a place on a course at the university where you studied. He/She would like your advice about finding a place to live. Write a letter to your friend. In your letter
-describe where you lived when you were a student at the university
-recommend the best way for him/her to look for accommodation
-warn him/her of mistakes students make when choosing accommodation
text: I’m writing to you to suggest some solutions to your housing issues that I had experienced before.

I used to live in the centre of the city on Lord Street in a sublet house where I’d suffered a lot as their lifestyle did not match with mine. In addition, there were no cooking facilities as my meal was included with my rent.

In my opinion, the best way for a student is to stay with other students, which could assist them to discuss about their study if they are from the same discipline, and their living style is the same. About the privately rented house, the meal could be an issue unless you do cook.

I’ll advise you not to travel to a real estate agent, which can cost you a lot of money, although you may be unaware when you start with them. Therefore, university accommodation is the best if you can manage it.

error_list.error_des: The preposition about seems unecessary after the verb discuss. Consider removing the preposition.
